H0.text: what form of government does the united states have. Democracy

H1.text: what form of government does the united states have. Federal System

H2.text: what form of government does the united states have. Constitutional Government

H3.text: what form of government does the united states have. Republic

A4.text: Under the U.S. Constitution, the power of the U.S. federal government is shared between its executive, legislative, and judicial branches, state governments, and the people.

A5.text: One of the theoretical pillars of the U.S. Constitution is the idea of 'checks and balances' among the powers and responsibilities of the three branches of American government: the executive, the legislative, and the judiciary.

A6.text: Official website (Portal of the U.S. Federal government of the United States)
